Participant Paula: ## Paula: ## Paula:

That's a great question, Connor! The reasons behind driving on different sides of the road are actually quite historical.  

In many countries that drive on the left, it's thought to be linked to the way people traditionally carried swords on their dominant side.  If you were right-handed, you'd carry your sword on your left side, leaving your right hand free to use the reins when riding a horse. This made it safer to pass other riders on the left, as it allowed them to see each other coming and avoid collisions. 

Of course, things have changed a lot since then, but the tradition of driving on the left side of the road persisted in many places.

On the other hand, countries that drive on the right often adopted this side after the invention of the automobile.
